results.name: about_yml
results.description: A gem for the .about.yml project metadata schema and tools

results.name: developer-program
results.description: A suite of tools, resources, and consulting services to assist agencies in the production and management of government APIs.  This two-year-old program was adopted by 18F to scale out its impact and to grow the governmentâ€™s API portfolio.
results.impact: Over 70 agencies served, including each cabinet department, National Archives, Federal Communications Commission, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, and the Office of Personnel Management.

results.name: edu
results.description: 18F Edu is the self-guided training component of the 18F Learn initiative. It aims to supplement the 18F Guides with hands-on exercises that can solidify your grasp of those materials. The combined body of 18F Guides and 18F Edu training modules aim to support the concepts promoted in the U.S. Digital Services Playbook.

results.name: hub
results.mission: The 18F Hub is a Jekyll-based documentation platform that aims to help 18F and other development teams organize and easily share their information, and to enable easy exploration of the connections between team members, projects, and skill sets. It aims to serve as the go-to place for all of a team's working information, whether that information is integrated into the Hub directly or provided as links to other sources. It also serves as a lightweight tool that other teams can experiment with and deploy with a minimum of setup.

results.name: 18f-site
results.description: The official website of 18F.

results.name: dap
results.description: A lightweight dashboard that shows web traffic across the .gov domain.
milestones: May 2012: Digital Government Strategy calls for a government-wide analytics program
August 2014: Full Digital Analytics Program access expanded to all federal staff at participating agencies

results.name: api-data-gov
results.description: A hosted, shared-service that provides an API key, analytics, and proxy solution for government web services. We are currently accepting clients for this free service: contact us to learn more.
results.impact: 2,800 API users and 66 million API requests served since July 2013

results.name: authentication
results.description: HTTP request authentication guide

results.name: betaFEC
results.description: A new Federal Election Commission (FEC) website that will make campaign finance information more accessible and understandable to all users.
milestones: May 2015: Alpha testing of API and website
July 2015: Beta testing of the API
October 2015: Public release of beta site
results.impact: The FEC collects data about how campaigns are financed that affect all 318 million Americans every 2 years.

results.name: C2
results.description: an approval process automation tool

results.name: calc
results.description: CALC is a tool to help contracting personnel estimate their per-hour labor costs for a contract, based on historical pricing information.
results.impact: All federal acquisition personnel involved in buying professional services
milestones: July 2015: Second release with price analysis tools, status changed to live

results.name: cloud.gov
results.description: cloud.gov takes care of infrastructure concerns so teams can focus all of their efforts on their app rather than fighting the environment
results.impact: The cloud.gov PaaS has the potential to reduce costs and complexity of IT projects across the federal government by an order of magnitude.

links.text: Project Calendar (standups, reviews, and planning meetings)

results.name: collegescorecard
results.description: Engage and educate potential college students of any age or background and those who support and advise them, to find schools best suited to them.

results.name: dashboard
results.description:
A site to track our projects' status, to provide transparency and insight
into 18F work and values.
errors: The property '#/contact/0' of type String did not match the following type: object in schema f49a6215-63a1-5890-a933-cba5ec9c73a0#

results.name: dataact
results.description: Consulting engagement to advise on the federal spending data standards and corresponding pilot project mandated by the DATA Act.
partners: All federal agencies can benefit from the pilot software and lessons learned as they prepare to comply with the DATA Act.
results.impact: The federal agencies, state and local governments, transparency advocacy organizations, non-profits, academic researchers, and individuals who use federal spending data.

results.name: methods
results.description: A collection of design and research methods, including general descriptions and how-tos, to share how we work and build a common design vocabulary.
milestones: April 2015: Conducted one-on-one interviews with design leads across roughly 10 projects.

May 2015: Built prototype sets of alpha method cards to get some quick feedback on our concept. Conducted a few more formal usability tests of the card decks, which led to some changes in the beta version.

June 2015: Ran randomized, controlled experiment to measure how method cards affected our 18F teammatesâ€™ knowledge and comfort with our design methods. People who received cards were slightly more knowledgeable and comfortable with methods than a control group whose members didnâ€™t receive cards.
August 2015: Launched online, beta version of the methods at methods.18f.gov, including files and instructions for printed cards.

results.name: discovery
results.description: Market research tool for the OASIS procurement vehicle, which serves contracting specialists throughout the U.S. Federal Government.
milestones: May 2014: Initial Discovery stage began for task order generator project
June 2014: Project pivoted based on user interviews and Discovery stage began for market research tool
July 2014: Work on Alpha stage began for market research tool

results.name: dodsbir-scrape
results.description: A scraper for the SBIR topics housed on dodsbir.net

results.name: ekip-api
results.description:
The Every Kid in a Park initiative is part of President Obamaâ€™s commitment to protect 
our Nationâ€™s unique outdoor spaces and ensure that every American has the opportunity 
to visit and enjoy them. This initiative provides all fourth grade students and their 
families with free admission to National Parks and other federal lands and waters for 
a full year.
results.impact: Written at a 4th grade level and tested with kids, this site provides an optimized user experience to generate a paper pass to visit national lands and waters.

links.text: Every Kid in a Park Website

results.name: doi-extractives-data
results.description: This site and open data portal supports the Presidentâ€™s Open Gov Partnership National Action Plan commitment to the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative.
results.impact: Revenue from the sale of natural resources on Federal lands totaled $97.5 billion between 2003 to 2013.

results.name: fbopen
results.description: FBOpen helps small businesses search for opportunities to work with the U.S. government.
results.impact: There are nearly 40,000 active federal opportunities right now.
milestones: May 2014: 18F took over project maintenance from Presidential Innovation Fellows program
results.mission: To aggregate and make more accessible diverse opportunities to do business with the U.S. Government

results.name: federalist
results.description: Federalist is a unified interface for publishing static government websites. It automates common tasks for integrating GitHub, Amazon Web Services and content editing to provide a simple way for developers to launch new websites or more easily manage existing ones.

results.name: foia
results.description: A new tool to search for the correct agency or office to make a FOIA request.
results.partners: Also participating: FOIA agency task force.
results.impact: The U.S. Federal Government processed nearly 700,000 FOIA requests in fiscal year 2013.

results.name: hmac-authentication-npm
results.description: Signs and validates HTTP requests based on a shared-secret HMAC signature

results.name: midas
results.description: A platform that facilitates collaborative work worldwide. Individuals can create projects, propose working groups, or assemble "tiger teams" to act on their ideas. Anyone can also post tasks online and people with the requisite skills can respond and complete the task.
partner: Department of Health and Human Services
milestones: October 2014: GSA hosts Midas open source hack night in DC
October 2014: DigitalGov Open Opportunities pilot starts
September 2014: GSA OCSIT signs MOU for Open Opportunities to move to Midas platform
September 2014: 18F launches https://midas.18f.us for use by early adopters
June 2014: State Department launches Alpha as Crowdwork
May 2014: HHS launches Alpha as FairTrade
June 2013: State Department begins project Discovery stage with Presidential Innovation Fellows

results.name: myra
results.description: Landing page design for Treasuryâ€™s My Retirement Account program, which will provide a simple, safe, and affordable way for individuals to start saving for retirement.
results.impact: Millions of Americans do not have access to an employer-sponsored retirement plan, which includes more than 50% of full-time and 75% of part-time workers.
milestones: September 2014: Project moved from discovery to alpha
June 2015: Project handed off to partner

results.name: myusa
results.description: A digital services platform for Americans to register, sign in, and manage ongoing transactions with U.S. Federal Government services.
partners: Early adopters ready for launch include Small Business Administration, Department of Labor, and GSA.
results.impact: The millions of Americans who conduct online transactions with U.S. government.
milestones: September 2014: Alpha delivered to clients and user testing started

results.name: openfec
results.description:
Redesigning how the Federal Election Commission shares campaign finance information and regulations. This effort involves:
  • The FECâ€™s first API
  • A new campaign finance portal (Coming soon!)
  • An eventual redesign of the agencyâ€™s website.
results.impact: The FEC collects data about how campaigns are financed that affect all 318 million Americans every 2 years.
milestones: May 2015: Alpha testing of API and website
July 2015: Beta testing of the API

results.name: pages
results.description: Publishing platform for 18F sites a la GitHub Pages

results.name: pages-server
results.description: Static website publishing server for 18F Pages

results.name: peacecorps-site
results.description: A redesign of peacecorps.gov, offering a new, user-focused experience for users.
results.impact: 7,000 Peace Corps Volunteers in the field, hundreds of thousands Prospective/Returned Volunteers, friends, and family.

results.name: pulse
results.description: A lightweight dashboard that uses the official .gov domain list to measure HTTPS integration and participation in the Digital Analytics Program.
milestones: May 2015: Site launched and developed in the open

results.name: sbirez
results.description: An application to simplify, streamline, and unify the Small Business Innovation Research application process.
results.impact: To encourage new small businesses to work with the Federal Government.

results.name: team_api
results.description: A gem for compiling information about team members, projects, etc. and exposing it via a JSON API.

results.name: uscis
results.description: We are helping to reimage and modernize immigration and visa processes: building tools that improve the applicant process, providing clear and simple information to the public, and creating new tools that make the processing of immigration forms faster and more efficient.
results.impact: Every year, hundreds of thousands of individuals travel to the United States in pursuit of work, education, leisure, or with the hope of becoming a US resident or citizen.
